title: Stat 243Z: Elementary Statistics
text:
Welcome to Stat 243Z.



Instructor: Dr. Daniel Kim
Title: Elementary Statistics




The standard normal CDF is ( (z) = P(Z z) ).



import numpy as np, matplotlib.pyplot as plt from scipy.stats import norm x = np.linspace(-4,4,401) y = norm.pdf(x)
#plot the normal curve from xlim=-4 and 4, and then fill the area between -2 and 2 in red color) plt.xlim(-4, 4) plt.ylim(0, 0.5) plt.plot(x, y, color=‘black’) plt.fill_between(x,0,y, where=(x>=-2) & (x<=2), color=‘red’) plt.title(“Standard Normal PDF”); plt.xlabel(“z”); plt.ylabel(“density”) plt.tight_layout(); plt.show()

title: Stat 243Z: Elementary Statistics
text:
import numpy as np, matplotlib.pyplot as plt from scipy.stats import norm x = np.linspace(-4,4,401) y = norm.pdf(x)
#plot the normal curve from xlim=-4 and 4, and then fill the area between -2 and 2 in red color) plt.xlim(-4, 4) plt.ylim(0, 0.5) plt.plot(x, y, color=‘black’) plt.fill_between(x,0,y, where=(x>=-2) & (x<=2), color=‘red’) plt.title(“Standard Normal PDF”); plt.xlabel(“z”); plt.ylabel(“density”) plt.tight_layout(); plt.show()
